column1: Male patient, 61 years old, with negative remote medical history.
Pathological history of the next contact in the third week of February with relative from the Veneto region subjected to swab for Covid-19, with negative results.
He arrives in pulmonary stenosis for the onset of acute dyspnea and cough.
computed/computerized tomography scan of the chest is performed without intravenous administration of contrast medium.
Axial images, Lung algorithm reconstruction, apical, average and basal scans

In LSD, LSS, LM and lingula plurime areas of increased lung density with frosted glass, which is associated with inter- and intra-lobular septal thickening, with a prevalent peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution; parenchymal thickening, with patent air bronchogram, to the lower lobes.
Coronal reconstruction, reconstruction with Lung algorithm

Bilaterally, multiple areas of increased frosted glass lung density, with associated inter- and intra-lobular septal thickening, with a prevalent peribroncovasal and subpleural distribution; parenchymal thickenings, with patent air bronchogram in the lower lobes.
